oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Muon-spin-spectroscopy study of the penetration depth of FeTe(0.5)Se(0.5)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BISWAS, PK
BALAKRISHNAN, G
PAUL, DM
TOMY, CV
LEES, MR
HILLIER, AD
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ii superconductors
43 k
density
tc
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Muon-spin-spectroscopy measurements have been used to study the superconducting state of FeTe(0.5)Se(0.5). The temperature dependence of the in-plane magnetic penetration depth, lambda(ab)(T), is found to be compatible with either a two-gap s+s-wave or an anisotropic s-wave model. The value for lambda(ab)(T) at T = 0 K is estimated to be lambda(ab)(0) = 534(2) nm.
